text.text_translated:
Earthquakes can damage all structures, including bridges.  
Luckily, bridges do not collapse often.  
Modern bridges also do not collapse often.  
Engineers design bridges in earthquake zones.  
They build them on strong ground.  
This ground does not move easily.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Earthquakes shake and break all buildings and other things.  
They also shake and break bridges.  
Luckily, bridges do not fall often.  
This is because new bridges are less likely to fall.  
Engineers design bridges for earthquake areas.  
They put them on ground that does not move much.
